p: The major components of the leaf essential oil of P. corymbosa (reported as P. integrifolia) from Bangladesh were phytol (27.3%), α-humulene (14.2%), spathulenol (12.1%), 1-octen-3-ol (8.2%), eugenol (6.7%), and phenylethyl alcohol (5.8%) [ 46]. Neither 1-octen-3-ol, phenylethyl alcohol, nor eugenol were detected in the samples from Vietnam. Likewise, neither α-copaene nor allo-aromadendrene were reported from the Bangladeshi sample. In contrast, P. corymbosa leaf essential oil (reported as P. serratifolia) displayed a very simple composition of eugenol (47.9%), eugenyl acetate (9.1%), massoialactone (32.9%), and a compound identified as cis-2-oxabicyclo[4.4.0]decane (12.4%) (likely incorrect based on relative retention times) [ 47]. Thus, there is wide variation in the essential oil compositions of this plant, which suggests different chemotypes are possible or these three plants represent different species.
